The spare, friendly space, located on Nyhavn Harbor just across the bridge that leads to Barr is the perfect place for a few snacks and carefully composed plates that lean very Danish (confit herring with rosemary mayo) to pair with the biodynamic wine list.ORDER THE: sourdough with fresh cheese and olive oil (add lumpfish roe in spring); “crisp” with smoked mackerel; and a bottle of anything from hard-to-get producer L’Anglore. Come summer, a grill has been known to appear on the large outdoor terrace across the street for the best kind of barbecues.THE VIBE IS: pleasantly chill, with off-duty chefs and natural-wine tourists geeking out in a brick-and-blond-wood room.PRACTICAL STUFF: Open for dinner Tuesday to Friday, from 4 p.m. to 11 p.m.; Saturday, from 1 p.m. to 11 p.m.; and Sunday, from 1 p.m. to 9 p.m. Closed Monday.—Christine MuhlkePhoto by Ditte IsagerWE ALSO LOVEAncestraleIn Vesterbro, a cool little wine bar (and a relief to your wallet) VinskabetIndulge your inner wine geek at this breezy Nørrebro bar.Ved Stranden 10Get lost in natural wines at this living room-esque Indre By barExplore City GuidesAtlantaAustinBostonCharlestonChicagoCopenhagenLas VegasLondonLos AngelesMexico CityMiamiMontrealNew OrleansNew YorkParisPhiladelphiaPortlandSan FranciscoSeattleTokyoTorontoVancouverWashington, D.C.GET THE MAGAZINEBA LogoBon appetitSUBSCRIBESign up for Updates on the Bon AppétitCity GuidesSign UpWill be used in accordance with our user agreement and privacy policyBA LogoBon appetitSubscription FAQsMastheadNewsletter SignupAccessibility HelpRSS FeedsSite MapCondé Nast StoreCareersBon Appétit Media KitDo Not Sell My Personal InformationCondé NastFood Innovation Group: Bon Appétit and Epicurious© 2022 Condé Nast.
